meanings.definition: The process of becoming accustomed to a new climate or environment.
meanings.sent1: After moving to the mountains, her acclimatization to the high altitude took some time.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the acclimatization of the plants to the tropical weather.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's acclimatization to the desert heat would make for a funny cartoon.
meanings.sent4: Her acclimatization to the bustling city life was like a fish learning to breathe on land.
meanings.sent5: The acclimatization of the astronaut to zero gravity was a remarkable feat of human adaptation.

meanings.definition: The act of adjusting to a new situation or condition.
meanings.sent1: His acclimatization to the fast-paced work environment was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The team's acclimatization to the sudden change in project requirements was challenging.
meanings.sent3: The cat's acclimatization to wearing a tiny hat was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: Her acclimatization to the role of team leader was like stepping into a new world.
meanings.sent5: The acclimatization of the students to the new school rules was a smooth process.
